article.title: Effects of four computer-mediated communications channels on trust development
article.author: Bos, Nathan
Olson, Judy
Gergle, Darren
Olson, Gary
Wright, Zach
article.abstract: When virtual teams need to establish trust at a distance, it is advantageous for them to use rich media to communicate. We studied the emergence of trust in a social dilemma game in four different communication situations: face-to-face, video, audio, and text chat. All three of the richer conditions were significant improvements over text chat. Video and audio conferencing groups were nearly as good as face-to-face, but both did show some evidence of what we term delayed trust (slower progress toward full cooperation) and fragile trust (vulnerability to opportunistic behavior)
